New Records: The Houston Rockets snapped a two-game skid with a 110-99 victory over the Dallas Mavericks on January 2, 2025.
Key Match Events: The Rockets built a 61-52 halftime lead with a strong 21-8 run in the second quarter.
Houston maintained a double-digit lead throughout the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyrie Irving, Klay Thompson, and Dereck Lively II returned from absences, while Naji Marshall remained out due to suspension.
Post-Match Reflections: The Rockets' win helped them stay relevant in the standings without key bench players like Amen Thompson.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets made 18 of 23 free throws, compared to Dallas' 8 of 16.
Both teams will face different opponents on Friday night.
